articles.headline: Russia-Ukraine Fight Over Narrow Sea Passage Risks Wider War
articles.snippet: The opening of an overt front at sea introduced an unstable element into what had been a long-running war fought over land in eastern Ukraine.
articles.abstract: The opening of an overt front at sea introduced an unstable element into what had been a long-running war fought over land in eastern Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Ukraine’s president put his nation on a war footing with Russia on Monday, as tensions over a shared waterway escalated into a crisis that dragged in NATO and the United Nations.

articles.headline: Mexico’s New Leader Faces Clash With Trump Over Migrant Caravan
articles.snippet: As Andrés Manuel López Obrador takes office on Saturday, he must balance his humanitarian promises with a hope for good relations with the United States.
articles.abstract: As Andrés Manuel López Obrador takes office on Saturday, he must balance his humanitarian promises with a hope for good relations with the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — The new president of Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, has built his entire political career on defending the poor.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Elisabeth Malkin

articles.headline: Netflix for Conservatives? Fox News Introduces Fox Nation, a Streaming App
articles.snippet: For viewers who can’t get enough of “Fox & Friends,” a $5.99-a-month service courts the cable news network’s superfans.
articles.abstract: For viewers who can’t get enough of “Fox & Friends,” a $5.99-a-month service courts the cable news network’s superfans.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you have ever wondered about the culinary skills of a “Fox & Friends” co-host, wonder no longer. On the new show “Cooking With Steve Doocy,” the pink-faced Fox News anchor makes chili with Dr. Oz, shares a kitchen with Kellyanne Conway and whips up stromboli with Anthony Scaramucci and his wife.

articles.headline: Manafort Breached Plea Deal by Repeatedly Lying, Mueller Says
articles.snippet: Prosecutors said lies by Mr. Manafort, President Trump’s onetime campaign chairman, on “a variety of subject matters” relieved them of all promises they made to him in their deal.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors said lies by Mr. Manafort, President Trump’s onetime campaign chairman, on “a variety of subject matters” relieved them of all promises they made to him in their deal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, repeatedly lied to federal investigators in breach of a plea agreement he signed two months ago, the special counsel’s office said in a court filing late on Monday.

articles.headline: Why Trump’s Support for the Saudis May Not Help Them, or Him
articles.snippet: President Trump’s forceful support of Saudi Arabia’s crown prince may have backfired by prompting members of Congress to promise investigations of their own.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s forceful support of Saudi Arabia’s crown prince may have backfired by prompting members of Congress to promise investigations of their own.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than a month, business leaders across the country have been waiting to get a definitive answer from Washington about what turn the relationship between the United States and Saudi Arabia may take in the wake of the murder of Jamal Khashoggi — and how it might impact their business relationships with the kingdom.

articles.headline: More Small Companies Avoid I.P.O.s, Sapping U.S. Economy’s Vitality
articles.snippet: Small and midsize firms are increasingly steering clear of going public, giving big companies outsize influence over stock markets and hampering business creation, wage growth and productivity.
articles.abstract: Small and midsize firms are increasingly steering clear of going public, giving big companies outsize influence over stock markets and hampering business creation, wage growth and productivity.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ryan Smith spent years planning to sell shares of his software company, Qualtrics, on the stock market, meeting with bankers, carefully auditing financials and shaping a Wall Street-friendly narrative about the company’s prospects. Two weeks ago, the finish line was close, with a listing on the Nasdaq just a few days away.
articles.byline: By Erin Griffith and Matt Phillips

articles.headline: Condé Nast, Its Luster Dimmed by Losses, Is Looking for a New Chief
articles.snippet: After a rough third quarter, the once-flush publisher of Vogue, Vanity Fair and The New Yorker said its chief executive, Robert Sauerberg, would leave.
articles.abstract: After a rough third quarter, the once-flush publisher of Vogue, Vanity Fair and The New Yorker said its chief executive, Robert Sauerberg, would leave.
articles.lead_paragraph: Condé Nast, the once-flush publisher of Vogue, Vanity Fair, The New Yorker and other magazines, is looking for a new business leader after years of losses.
articles.byline: By Edmund Lee and Tiffany Hsu
